body: Japanese electronics retailer Bic Camera will enable bitcoin payments across all stores in the country this month. Tokyo-based consumer electronics retail chain Bic Camera becomes the latest major retailer to accept bitcoin throughout Japan, a report by
title: Japanese Retail Giant Accepts Bitcoin Nationwide after Successful Trial

body: Two of Australia’s four ‘big four’ banks have successfully completed a blockchain trial in digitizing the bank guarantee process for commercial property leasing. The Australia and New Zealand Banking Group (ANZ) and competing bank Westpac have both
title: Australian Megabanks ANZ, Westpac Complete Blockchain Bank Guarantees Trial with IBM

body: IOTA, a cryptocurrency designed for the Internet of Things (IoT), suffered over 26 percent recently. However, not just IOTA experienced a significant value drop but most of the other cryptocurrencies too, including bitcoin and ETH.
title: IOTA Falls Hard, Loses Over 25% on Tuesday

body: The market downturn picked up speed on Tuesday, as the total cryptocurrency market cap plunged to its lowest point since May. There has since been a slight recovery, although all of the major coins still post 24-hour losses.

metaInfo.author: Josiah Wilmoth
metaInfo.keywords: bitcoin price, ethereum price, ripple price

title: Crypto Calamity: Ethereum, Bitcoin Prices Sink as Market Plunges Below $80 Billion

body: A senior aide and advisor to China’s central bank has called for the regulation of ICO (initial coin offering) projects while urging investors to show caution. In an interview with prominent Chinese financial publication
title: Moderate Regulation Necessary for ICO Projects: PBoC Advisor

body: Bitcoin managed to escape much of the downward drift that has afflicted most cryptocurrencies today. In the most recent 24-hour period,   fell 2.82 percentage points to $2,367, according to coinmarketcap.com.
title: Bitcoin Manages to Evade the Crypto Market Crash

body: Ethereum prices have followed the trading pattern of nearly all digital currencies making highs in early June above $400 per coin. The chart below shows the trading action after the high was established and the measured pullback which is now in progress.
title: Ethereum Prices Trade at Support Levels after Tricky Waters

body: Litecoin fared better than most cryptocurrencies during today’s market plunge, only losing 3.8 percentage points where most cryptos suffered bigger hits, according to coinmarketcap.com. Among the cryptos with more than a billion in market capitalization, only bitcoin outperformed Litecoin in the most recent 24-hour period, losing only 2.82 points.
title: Litecoin Fares Better Than Most in Crypto Downturn

body: The Bank of Thailand (BOT) and the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) have entered a FinTech Cooperation Agreement (CA) to further develop and enhance the existing financial ecosystem in the ASEAN region.

metaInfo.author: Samburaj Das
metaInfo.keywords: bank of thailand, central banks, monetary authority of singapore

title: Singapore and Thailand Central Banks Unite in FinTech Deal

body: The South Korean government will issue permits to FinTech firms including bitcoin mediated foreign currency transfer services to enable international money transfers for small funds. Come August 15, about 40 FinTech firms are expected to launch international money transfer services after receiving permits from the Financial Supervisory Service, South Korea’s financial regulator.
title: South Korea Will Permit Bitcoin Firms for International Money Transfers

body: The Linux Foundation-led open-source Hyperledger blockchain consortium has released its first production-ready blockchain software in the formal release of Hyperledger Fabric 1.0. Heralding the release as a ‘huge milestone’ for a community of over 140 members representing a multitude of industries, Hyperledger Technical Steering Committee Chair and technical chief of open technology at IBM Chris Ferris underlined the effort of 159 engineers from 27 organizations contributing to the Hyperledger Fabric.
title: Hyperledger Releases Open-Source Production Ready Blockchain Software, Fabric 1.0

title: ‘Technically & Ethically Appalling’: Bitcoin Core Developer Slams SegWit2x

title: Japanese Bitcoin Exchanges will be Scrutinized by Financial Watchdog

body: Wednesday brought a welcome change to the markets. The bitcoin and ethereum prices stabilized after  , slowing the widespread market decline and enabling some coins to experience moderate recoveries.
title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Prices Stabilize as Market Downturn Slows

body: After yesterday’s crash, the crypto markets showed signs of recovery today, as many major currencies showed moderate gains of around 2% over the past 24 hours. Out of the top 10 currencies, Ethereum Classic registered the most gains, climbing nearly 13.5%.
title: Slight Recovery in Crypto Markets

body: As most cryptocurrencies start recovering from yesterday’s  , IOTA, a  designed for the Internet of Things (IoT), has suffered an 8 percent loss in the past 24 hours.
title: IOTA Is down by Nearly 50% in a 7-Day Period

body: Portuguese consumer protection organization  recently published an article about bitcoin in one of its monthly magazines, dubbed “ .” It essentially covers the basics and adds that more information is to come by the end of July.
title: Portuguese Consumer Organization Highlights Bitcoin Investing Couple

body: The selloff in most digital currencies raised eyebrows for many, but I noticed that the Ethereum Classic Coin (ETC) was trading in its own world and rallied 14% this week while Bitcoin, Ethereum and Ripple all got smashed giving back between 7% and 25% respectively.
title: Analysis: Ethereum Classic Traveling Down an Alternate Path in a Bikini

body: Ethereum Classic, the fifth largest cryptocurrency, emerged as the strongest performer among the currencies with over $1 billion in market capitalization in the last 24- and 7-day periods, according to coinmarketcap.com.
title: Ethereum Classic Jumps Ahead Of The Pack

body: The music industry has evolved in various ways, but the way artists are compensated hasn’t. Music labels and streaming platform such as YouTube, Spotify, Tidal, Apple Music, and Deezer can   and while well-known artists can get rich off their cut, smaller artists can barely put food on the table.
title: Opus Aims to Disrupt the Music Streaming Industry through Ethereum and IPFS

body: Russian authorities are looking into the possibility of registering real estate and housing projects on a blockchain. According to a regional report, the Russian Ministry of Communications is considering the use of blockchain technology for agencies including the
title: Russia is ‘Considering’ Blockchain Tech for Real Estate

body: The city of Zug, commonly known as the ‘Crypto Valley’ for hosting a number of industry startups, has announced a new Ethereum-based identity service for residents. Come September this year, residents of Zug will be use a mobile app to connect their identity with a cryptographic address on the Ethereum blockchain.
title: Bitcoin-Friendly Swiss City Announces Ethereum Digital ID Pilot
